clinicalDescription: Overview: Liver failure is when the liver has lost some or all of its functionality. Acute or chronic. Acute liver failure, known as fulminant hepatic failure is a medical emergency. Stages of liver failure - inflammation, fibrosis, cirrhosis, end-stage liver dieses (ESLD), and liver cancer. Presentation: Nausea, vomiting, loss of appetite, fatigue, diarrhea; yellowed skin and eyes (jaundice) along with belly pain and swelling; mental confusion (hepatic encephalopathy), easy bruising or bleeding Assessment: Depends on the cause and history, blood screening tests and liver function tests, liver biopsy, liver ultrasound, CT or MRI Plan: Medications (depends on cause, for example - meds to reverse poisoning with acetaminophen), dietary changes, surgery or possibly a liver transplant.Prognosis: Final stage of many liver diseases. Early stages of liver failure can often heal over time with proper treatment and lifestyle changes. However, the later stages of liver failure are not reversible.
